@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The JavaScript library that implements the CometVisu protocol. The Client handles all communication issues to supply the user of this object with reliable realtime data. It can be seen as the session layer (layer 5) according to the OSI model.

Christan Mayer; Tobias Bräutigam
0.5.3 (initial contribution) 0.10.0+0.11.0 (major refactoring)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: backendLoginUrl {String} URL of the login resource

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stop all running clients

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Is the communication running at the moment?

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Is the client connected to a backend at the moment?

@description.name: @description
@description.body: needed to be able to check if the incoming update is the initial answer or a successing update

@description.name: @description
@description.body: the currently used transport layer

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The server we are currently speaking to (read from the login response)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: manipulates the header of the current ajax query before it is been send to the server

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Name of the resource (e.g. login, read, write, chart)
@param.description: Name of the resource (e.g. login, read, write, chart)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: params {Map?} optional data needed to generate the resource path
@param.description: optional data needed to generate the resource path

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String|null} relative path to the resource, returns null when the backend does not provide that resource
@return.description: relative path to the resource, returns null when the backend does not provide that resource

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} Name of the resource (e.g. login, read, write, chart)
@param.description: Name of the resource (e.g. login, read, write, chart)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: path {String} relative path to the resource

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Subscribe to the addresses in the parameter. The second parameter (filter) is optional

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This function starts the communication by a login and then runs the ongoing communication task

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
loginOnly {Boolean} if true only login and backend configuration, no subscription
                            to addresses (default: false)
@param.description:
if true only login and backend configuration, no subscription
                            to addresses (default: false)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: credentials {Map?} not used in this client

@param.name: @param
@param.body: callback {Function} call this function when login is done
@param.description: call this function when login is done

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the json response from the parameter received from the used XHR transport

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates an XHR request. The request type depends von the "cv.xhr" environment setting (currently "qx" and "jquery" are supported)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handle errors from qooxdoos XHR request

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the last recorded error

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles login response, applies backend configuration if send by backend and forwards to the configurated transport handleSession function Parameter vary dependent from the XHR type used qx (Qooxdoo): ev {Event} the 'success' event from the XHR request jQuery: data {Object} The JSON data returned from the server textStatus {String} a string describing the status request {Object} the jqXHR object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This function stops an ongoing connection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Build the URL part that contains the addresses and filters

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This function sends a value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: address {String} address to send the value to
@param.description: address to send the value to

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Restart the connection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Can be overridden to record client communication with backend

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} type of event to record

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Can be overridden to provide an error handler for client errors

@param.name: @param
@param.body: format {String} 'monaco' for texteditor and 'dp' for Tree editor
@param.description: 'monaco' for texteditor and 'dp' for Tree editor

@param.body: format {String} 'monaco' for texteditor and 'dp' for Tree editor
@param.description: 'monaco' for texteditor and 'dp' for Tree editor
